meanings.definition: To cast a spell over someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The magician ensorcels the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent2: The witch ensorcels the potion to make it powerful.
meanings.sent3: The fairy ensorcels the forest to make it glow with magical light.
meanings.sent4: The enchantress ensorcels the night sky with shimmering stars.
meanings.sent5: The wizard ensorcels the book, making the words come to life.

meanings.sent1: The sorcerer ensorcels the prince to fall in love with the princess.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious amulet ensorcels all who gaze upon it.
meanings.sent3: The old spellbook ensorcels the young apprentice, filling her dreams with magic.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melody ensorcels the listeners, transporting them to another realm.
meanings.sent5: The mystical potion ensorcels the weary traveler, granting him strength and courage.
